title: Ticket #1471: submit_event_notes and submit_event_user_notes undocumented
description:
The following macros can be placed in submit description file given to condor_submit, and yet they are not documented:
  • submit_event_notes
  • submit_event_user_notes
remarks:
2010-Jun-21 13:43:17 by tannenba:
Kent, since you know these knobs well, could you please either document them directly into the manual, or alternatively please update this ticket w/ the details and then assign to Karen for transplantation into the manual? Mucho gracias!

2010-Dec-07 13:44:18 by wenger:
Hmm, Karen just pinged me about this ticket, which is the first I've known about it. Anyhow, I sent some info to her, but it also looks like submit_event_notes and submit_event_user_notes may not always work right in combination. Specifically (just from looking at the code, not from testing) it seems like if you write out an event with no submit_event_notes value, but a submit_event_user_notes value, that event won't get read correctly by the event-reading code -- that code assumes that the first thing it hits is submit_event_notes, but if you have only submit_event_user_notes I think that will be interpreted as submit_event_notes.

2010-Dec-07 14:42:35 by smoler:
submit_event_notes is now documented in the 7.4.4 and future manuals. Submit command submit_event_user_notes will remain quietly undocumented until it is fixed or determined that it works correctly.
